Posts.Content: Jan 16, 2019 12:15AM rrshannon wrote: @Toyamjj so sorry to hear that you are having to start this journey. When I was first diagnosed in 2003 my children were 1, 10, and 12. We told our older two after a positive surgical biopsy that didn't have clear margins. Which was 1 week before the Sentinel Node Biopsy. Fast forward to last month and I had to tell them the horrible news that I had a new cancer. Now 17, 26 and 28 I wanted to tell them all together with my husband. Their work schedules and the fact that my husband works out state did not make that possible. I had to tell my husband over the phone but then proceeded to visit each older child on the same day to break the news and ended the day with my 17 year old daughter and having to tell her. Though it was hard for me to give the news multiple times it was nice to be able to spend time with each child and answer his or her different questions. Since they each process news differently. Good Luck with your treatment, wishing you complete healing.
